decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.    Reason - To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy H8, Replacement UDP Policy 5.9. | Detailed drawings or samples of materials, as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of the work: (a)  details of the 'conservation velux' roof light to the side/rear roof slope, The development shall be implemented only in accordance with such details on drawings as approved.  REASON: To safeguard the special character of the dwelling and surrounding Creffield Conservation Area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B24 and ES6, and Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES6, H8 and H33, and Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9.
description: Dormer window extensions to rear and side/rear roof slopes and 1no. roof light to side/rear roof slope of dwelling
